intro: Stachys boissieri, commonly known as the Armenian betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, producing clusters of purple or pink tubular flowers. Stachys boissieri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine for its purported calming properties.
